title: 108_hr3514
content: The Pennsylvania National Forest Improvement Act of 2004 includes provisions for the disposal and conveyance of various administrative sites within the Allegheny National Forest in Pennsylvania. This Act also addresses the administration of land acquired by the United States and its relation to other conveyance authorities. The Secretary of Agriculture has the authority to convey National Forest System lands and administrative sites in the Allegheny National Forest, Pennsylvania, through sale or exchange. This includes specific tracts such as US Tract 121, Sheffield ranger residence, US Tract 896, an undeveloped site, and US Tract 1047, the original Marienville Ranger District Headquarters. The Allegheny National Forest in Pennsylvania includes specific tracts such as US Tract 121, Sheffield ranger residence, US Tract 896, an undeveloped site, and US Tract 1047, the original Marienville Ranger District Headquarters. Tract 896 consists of 2.42 acres, Tract 1047 consists of 4.90 acres, and Tract 844, the Marienville ranger residence, is depicted on a map from 1936. The Survey Plat prepared by D. M. Heller in 1999 is the primary description of the lands subject to conveyance under section 5. In case of conflict, the map description prevails unless the map is unavailable. The maps are available for public inspection until the lands are disposed of. As consideration for land conveyance, the recipient may convey other land or improvements with the Secretary's consent. As consideration for land conveyance under this section, the recipient may convey other land, improvements, or cash equalization payments. Any land conveyance is subject to laws and regulations applicable to the National Forest System. Offers may be solicited for land exchanges. The Secretary may give preference to public entities for land conveyance under this section for public purposes. Offers for land conveyance can be solicited with specific terms and conditions, and offers may be rejected if deemed inadequate or not in the public interest. The Secretary may prescribe terms and conditions for land conveyance under this section. Offers can be rejected if deemed inadequate or not in the public interest. Upon conveyance, any public order withdrawing the land is revoked. Additional terms and conditions may be required to protect the interests of the United States. The Sheffield Ranger District Headquarters in Warren County, Pennsylvania will be conveyed. The Secretary of Agriculture may convey US Tract 770, Sheffield Ranger District Headquarters, consisting of 5.50 acres, to the Warren County Development Association for a lump sum payment of $100,000. The map titled "Allegheny Unit, Elk Tanning Company Tract 770, 1934" serves as the primary description of the lands. The map titled "Allegheny Unit, Elk Tanning Company Tract 770, 1934" is the definitive description of the lands being conveyed by the Secretary of Agriculture. Any public order withdrawing the land from appropriation laws is revoked upon conveyance. SEC. 4. CONVEYANCE OF RIDGEWAY RANGER DISTRICT HEADQUARTERS, ELK COUNTY, PENNSYLVANIA. The Secretary of Agriculture may convey US Tract 904 and US Tract 905 to Ridgeway Township, Pennsylvania, for fair market value as determined by an appraisal. The maps provided are the primary description of the lands. The Secretary may convey US Tract 904 and US Tract 905 to Ridgeway Township for fair market value determined by an appraisal. The maps serve as the primary description of the lands, revoking any public order withdrawing the land from appropriation laws upon conveyance. The Secretary is authorized to convey Marienville Ranger Residence in Forest County, Pennsylvania. The Secretary of Agriculture may convey, without consideration, to the Marienville Volunteer Fire Department of Forest County, Pennsylvania, all right, title, and interest of the United States in a portion of US Tract 844, Marienville ranger residence. The map titled "Allegheny Unit, Peter B. DeSmet Tract 844, 1936" serves as the primary description of the lands. In case of a conflict between map and metes/bounds descriptions, the map is the definitive description unless it cannot be found. The map must be available for public inspection until the lands are disposed of. Upon land conveyance by the Secretary, any public order withdrawing the land from appropriation is revoked. SEC. 6. DISPOSITION OF FUNDS. The Secretary of Agriculture shall deposit proceeds from sales or exchanges under section 2 and consideration received under sections 3(b) and 4(b) into the Sisk Act Fund. These funds can be used for administrative facilities, sites, land acquisition, and improvements in the Allegheny National Forest. Land acquisition using these funds is subject to the condition of the market value of the acquired lands. The Sisk Act Fund receives proceeds from sales and exchanges for administrative facilities, land acquisition, and improvements in the Allegheny National Forest. Land acquisition is limited to not exceeding 125% of the market value of lands disposed of under the Act. SEC. 7. Lands acquired by the Secretary of Agriculture under section 6(b) or by exchange shall be managed in accordance with the Weeks Act and other laws pertaining to National Forest System lands. The boundaries of the Allegheny National Forest will be adjusted based on land disposal and acquisition under this Act. SEC. 8. Relation to other conveyances authorities. SEC. 8. RELATION TO OTHER CONVEYANCES AUTHORITIES. Lands authorized for disposal under this Act shall not be subject to certain provisions of title 40, United States Code.
